data.title: Google, other companies get your data if you used Verily's coronavirus site
data.text: Verily says it only shares the data with Google with explicit permission. You can't use the service if you don't agree.

data.title: Alphabet's Cash Hoard Is Destroying Shareholder Value
data.text: Alphabet's Cash Hoard Is Destroying Shareholder Value

data.title: Tech titans erase more than $1 trillion in market sell-off
data.text: The so-called "MAGA" stocks, or Microsoft, Apple, Amazon and Google-parent have lost more than $1 trillion since the market rout began.

data.title: Google’s coronavirus testing website arrives – with serious privacy concerns
data.text: The site launched on Sunday and isn’t anything close to the nationwide tool pledged by Trump

data.title: Google Was Forced Into Disclosing YouTube Revenue by SEC
data.text: When Google's parent revealed YouTube revenue for the first time during the fourth quarter the motivation had less to do with transparency and more to do with appeasing a regulator.

data.title: Why FAANG Stocks Tumbled Today
data.text: With the market down big on pandemic fears, the largest tech stocks headed lower.

data.title: Google and Facebook shares could drop another 30% to 40%, Evercore analysts say
data.text: Despite both companies being about 25% off from their respective 52-week highs, trends show that the tech giants have ample room to fall before reaching panic levels.

data.title: Coronavirus Testing Website Goes Live and Runs Into Confusion
data.text: The site from Google’s sister company, Verily, was rolled out to two Northern California counties in hopes of guiding people to local virus testing.

data.title: Google parent Alphabet began sharing YouTube revenue after SEC request
data.text: Alphabet's chief accounting officer said the company would also disclose the growth of Google Cloud revenues "although we do not believe it is currently a required disclosure."

data.title: Google’s coronavirus screening website goes live in California
data.text: Google’s coronavirus screening website has gone live in the San Francisco area following a weekend of confusion that began when President Trump made a surprise announcement Friday that the search giant was building the tool. Trump revealed Google’s participation Friday during a Rose Garden press conference, announcing that the Silicon Valley company was working on.

data.title: Google parent Alphabet shared YouTube revenue after U.S. SEC request
data.text: Alphabet Inc  began disclosing revenue for its YouTube video service this year after U.S. securities regulators asked the Google parent to give more "quantitative and qualitative" data on the business, according to filings released Monday.

data.title: Verily’s coronavirus screening site is already out of testing appointments
data.text: Last night, slightly ahead of schedule, Verily launched its much-discussed coronavirus screening site. On the site, which is only available in parts of the Bay Area, users can describe their symptoms and Verily will then direct them to a testing site if necessary.

data.title: Google's Coronavirus Test Website Is Live... Sort Of
data.text: The catch: it's only for California's Bay Area residents and you have to be at least 18 to qualify.

data.title: How the Biggest Tech Stock Winners From the Bull Market Are Doing Now
data.text: During the most recent bull market, the technology sector was perhaps the biggest winner.

data.title: Google Sister Science Company Verily Launches Coronavirus Screening Website
data.text: Verily, Google’s sister company, has launched a screening website who want to get test for coronavirus, but it’s limited to people in the Bay Area of California, the Verge reported.

data.title: The Alphabet coronavirus screening website that Trump talked about last week is not currently taking appointments
data.text: Alphabet's website, built by Verily, says it's no longer taking reservations for coronavirus COVID-19 screenings in two California counties. It launched on Sunday evening.

data.title: Better Buy: Baidu vs. Alphabet
data.text: Comparing the Google parent to its Chinese counterpart means factoring in your tolerance for risk and desire for growth.

data.title: Google and YouTube aren’t entrusting COVID-19 to an algorithm
data.text:
In a time of medical crisis, the platforms are giving searchers hand-picked information from reliable sources.
Search for “coronavirus” or “COVID-19” on Google or YouTube, and you’ll probably notice some unusual results.

data.title: Alphabet’s Verily launches its California COVID-19 test screening site in a limited pilot
data.text: Alphabet -owned health technology company Verily has launched the COVID-19 screening site that was first misrepresented by President Trump as a broadly focused coronavirus web-based screening and testing utility developed by Google . After a flurry of blog posts by Google and Verily over the weekend, as well as a follow-up press conference by the […]

data.title: FAANG stocks diverge in performance as coronavirus reaches critical period
data.text: It’s looking to be another wild week on Wall Street, with index futures showing hefty drops in the 5% range following the Fed’s announcement over the weekend of an interest rate cut and an expansion of quantitative easing. Around the world, markets in Europe were down heavily as traders surveyed the full scale of the […]

data.title: ‘Google’s’ website that screens for the coronavirus is up and running (sorta)
data.text:
The “Google” website Trump promised that screens users for the coronavirus is live, but it’s not made by Google and only people living in two counties in the entire country can use it.
Last week President Trump made an announcement that surprised many: Google would soon launch a website that helps screen people for the coronavirus nation-wide.

data.title: Google Trends During Pandemic: How To Make Hand Sanitizer, If Trump's Infected, Symptoms, And More
data.text: The coronavirus pandemic is changing the way people lead their daily lives and bringing anxieties to the fore.

data.title: Google's Sister Verily Is Developing A Site To Help US Test Coronavirus Cases
data.text: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG) is developing a website to help decide if an individual needs to be tested for the novel coronavirus (COVID-19).

data.title: Alphabet's Verily launches coronavirus testing website for SF Bay Area
data.text: California Governor Gavin Newsom said he hopes the partnership with Google's sister company could be a "national model" for coronavirus screening.
